ace_zero.utils module¶

Utility Functions

ace_zero.utils.constrain_180(angle)[source]¶

Constrains the angle in degrees to (-180, 180)

ace_zero.utils.constrain_360(angle)[source]¶

Constrains the angle in degrees to (0, 360)

ace_zero.utils.distance(p1, p2)[source]¶

Calculates the distance between two positions

ace_zero.utils.feet_to_metres(a)[source]¶

Converts feet to metres

ace_zero.utils.get_aspect_angle(obj1, obj2)[source]¶
ace_zero.utils.get_bearing_angle(obj1, obj2)[source]¶
ace_zero.utils.get_location_vector(obj)[source]¶
ace_zero.utils.get_range(obj1, obj2)[source]¶
ace_zero.utils.get_velocity_vector(obj)[source]¶
ace_zero.utils.is_angle_ccw(angle_1, angle_2)[source]¶

Returns True if the shortest angle from angle_1 to angle_2 is counter-clockwise

ace_zero.utils.is_close(a, b, rel_tol=1e-09, abs_tol=0.0)[source]¶

Returns True if a and b are close to within floating point error (can be replaced by math.isclose() in Python 3.5+)

ace_zero.utils.is_reciprocal(h1, h2)[source]¶

Returns True if the headings are reciprocal (at 180 degrees)

ace_zero.utils.knots_to_mps(a)[source]¶

Converts knots to metres per second

ace_zero.utils.lateral_displacement(own_x, own_y, threat_x, threat_y, threat_heading, threat_range)[source]¶

Returns the perpendicular distance to the threat flight path using the approximation displacement(ft) = 100 * TAA(deg) * range(NM)

ace_zero.utils.metres_to_feet(a)[source]¶

Converts metres to feet

ace_zero.utils.metres_to_nautical_miles(a)[source]¶

Converts metres to nautical miles

ace_zero.utils.mps_to_knots(a)[source]¶

Converts metres per second to knots

ace_zero.utils.mps_to_mach(v)[source]¶

Converts speed from metres per second to mach number.

ace_zero.utils.nautical_miles_to_metres(a)[source]¶

Converts nautical miles to metres

ace_zero.utils.reciprocal_heading(heading)[source]¶

Calculates the reciprocal (anti-parallel) heading

ace_zero.utils.relative_bearing(own_x, own_y, other_x, other_y)[source]¶

Calculates the bearing from one position to another

ace_zero.utils.smallest_angle(a, b)[source]¶

Returns the smallest angle between two angles including direction

ace_zero.utils.target_aspect_angle(own_x, own_y, threat_x, threat_y, threat_heading)[source]¶

Calculates the target aspect angle (TAA)
